intro: Gomphocarpus semiamplectens, commonly known as the blue ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds with silky hairs. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique and showy blooms.
